com.github.jlynx

Interface DAO

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DAOImpl

    public interface DAO
extends java.io.Serializable
    This interface defines methods to persist and retrieve POJOs from relational databases systems (RDBMS), and to fetch results as Java objects. Requires Java 1.5 or higher.
    Since:
    v1.0
    Version:
    1.8.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean delete()
      Deletes 1 row from a database.
      boolean executeSql(java.lang.String sql, java.lang.Object[] params)
      Execute query.
      java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      The current connection.
      java.util.List<?> getList(java.lang.Class<?> resultClass, java.lang.String query, java.lang.Object[] params)
      Returns a list of objects from the database.
      int insert()
      Inserts 1 row into a database.
      int save()
      Saves POJO to database; equivalent to update() if record exists or insert() if record does not exist.
      void saveNulls(boolean keepNullsInQuery)
      Whether null should be preserved in UPDATE and INSERT statements; by default NULL property values are removed from the statement.
      boolean select()
      Select the associated record from the database and populate the POJO's values; PK value must be set first!
      DAO setBean(java.lang.Object bean)
      Sets the object to be used in database transactions.
      int update()
      Update 1 row in the database.

      • delete

        boolean delete()
        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes 1 row from a database.
        Returns:
        boolean - Was the record deleted? Yes or No
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - a database exception
        Since:
        v1.0

      • getList

        java.util.List<?> getList(java.lang.Class<?> resultClass,
                          java.lang.String query,
                          java.lang.Object[] params)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                          java.lang.InstantiationException
        Returns a list of objects from the database.
        Parameters:
        resultClass - Class literal to store results
        query - SQL statement
        params - SQL statement parameters (see java.sql.PreparedStatement)
        Returns:
        List
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - database exception
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - - exception
        java.lang.InstantiationException - - exception
        Since:
        v1.3
        See Also:
        PreparedStatement.executeQuery()

      • insert

        int insert()
    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts 1 row into a database.
        Returns:
        int No. of rows inserted -- or -- ID of record inserted (MySQL and Microsoft SQL Server only)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - database exception
        Since:
        v1.0

      • save

        int save()
  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Saves POJO to database; equivalent to update() if record exists or insert() if record does not exist. POJO is then updated with current database values.
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - database exception

      • saveNulls

        void saveNulls(boolean keepNullsInQuery)
        Whether null should be preserved in UPDATE and INSERT statements; by default NULL property values are removed from the statement. Empty Strings are treated as NULLs if set to true.
        Parameters:
        keepNullsInQuery - true (nulls are preserved) or false (default - nulls removed from SQL queries)
        Since:
        v1.0

      • select

        boolean select()
        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Select the associated record from the database and populate the POJO's values; PK value must be set first!
        Returns:
        boolean if records exists returns true
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - database exception
        Since:
        v1.0

      • setBean

        DAO setBean(java.lang.Object bean)
        Sets the object to be used in database transactions. Object MUST have a @Table annotation (as of v1.8)!
        Parameters:
        bean - any POJO
        Returns:
        DAO
        Since:
        v1.7.0

      • getConnection

        java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        The current connection.
        Returns:
        Connection - jdbc connection
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - database exception
        Since:
        v1.7.2

      • update

        int update()
    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Update 1 row in the database.
        Returns:
        int - No. of rows affected by the update (should return 1)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - database exception
        Since:
        v1.0
